bibl.title: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Florence M. Read, December 2, 1926

div1.p: Laura Carter expresses her gratitude to the International Health Board for their tribute to Henry Carter.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Florence M. Read, December 2, 1926
div1.opener:
I. H. B.
Biographic
------------
The Johns Hopkins School of Hygiene and
Public Health,
615 North Wolfe Street,
Baltimore, Maryland.
December 2, 1926.
My Dear Miss Read:
div1.p:
Your letter of November 30th., enclosing the copy of
the Minutes of the International Health Board concerning
Father, has just reached me.

I have no words to adequately express how deeply
touched I am at this most beautiful tribute to Father.
It shall always remain one of my most treasured posses-
sions, as shall your letter of transmittal, giving the
details of how perfectly this perfect thing was done.

With deepest appreciation to the International
Health Board from myself and the rest of the family,
div1.closer:
Sincerely and gratefully yours, Laura A. Carter Miss Florence M. Read, Executive Secretary,
International Health Board,
61 Broadway, New York, N. Y.
